title: manager
description: Operated as an intelligence analyst and reporter while working with linguist and analysts in a joint environment to provide threat tippers, target characterizations, answers for Requests for Information (RFI's), and analytical products. Part of a team of Signal Intelligence Analysts in support of Brigade and Division level assets who developed high value individuals which led to the capture of numerous high value individuals and reduced the IED threat drastically. Exposure to All-Source Analysis systems, ELINT and FUSION Analysis as well as HUMINT andIMINT. Incorporated research and analysis of all-source data derived from multiple and specialized databases into actionable intelligence products. Wrote several Informal Technical Notes (ITNs) focused on high interest activity in the Middle East. Created working database for long-term analytical focuses and assisted in the construction of a new SOP in order to increase mission effectiveness and decrease the time needed for a new analyst to become mission capable. Experience with the following communications systems: GSM, HPCP, VOICESAIL, PUSH TO TALK, and DTMF Devices Provided training for intelligence soldiers ready to deploy on Insurgency communications, SIGINT analyst, target packages, and methodology behind tracking terrorist networks. Produced numerous SIGINT Intelligence packages for forward deployed units. (Daily use and access) software and programs: Association, Mainway, Banyan, Fascia, SIGINT Navigator, ArcView, GoldMiner, sharkFinn, GeoT,SortingLead, Renoir, Pathfinder, GRSOC Metrics, Analysts Notebook, Global reach, Gistqueue and Other SIGINT related databases Provided actionable intelligence reports in direct support of real world counter-terrorist operations. Worked in collaboration with various Intelligence Agencies in order to develop aterrorist database. COLLECTION ANALYST National Security Agency (NSA)

Developes and presents complex training programs for customers and in-house employees. Coordinates with program management training, marketing and engineering personnel to identify program needs, obtain technical data and provide schedules for programs of instruction. Test trainees to measure their learning progress and to evaluate effectiveness of training presentations. Conducts training programs on complex topics, and designed and developed training program elements/modules. Provides guidance and direction to less experienced trainers utilizing strong technical and training skills. Reviews or produces technical documentation and recommends measures to improve methods, performance, and the quality of products/services, and suggests changes to increase efficiency/effectiveness in training delivery. Participates with software developers to optimize TGS systems functionality to meet user requirements; provides recommendations for resolution of technical problems where required. Responsible for maintaining and updating the TGS NET Training calendar for all TGS Systems throughout the Army units and National Guard units.
